newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian OLOs down on IFO but Bund spread narrows.
newsitem.headline: Belgian OLOs down on IFO but Bund spread narrows.

text.p: Belgian linear bonds lagged the decline in Bunds on Wednesday making the market seem even more expensive and raising the chances of a sharp move lower in the near future, traders said.
"I still see the market as overbought with room to come down," one said.

The decline was triggered by strong July German business climate figures from the IFO, dashing -- or at least heavily undermining -- high hopes for a cut in the repo rate at Thursday's meeting of the Bundesbank Council, traders said.
The benchmark 2006 OLO ended the day yielding 6.64 percent, up from Tuesday's 6.59, and the spread over Bunds narrowed three basis points to 30.
The front-month futures contract fell 51 basis points to 115.95. Three-month Treasury certificates yielded 3.25/31 percent against Tuesday's 3.27/29.
The Belgian franc/mark rate was 20.6015/35 compared with 20.6010/30.
The IFO index rocketed to 94.1 from 90.4 in June, confounding expectations of a rise to 91.0 and sending a strong signal that the Bundesbank might feel reluctant to cut the repo.
The figures triggered a spate of selling, particularly in five year paper where the yield jumped to 5.48 percent from 5.39 overnight.
But traders added that yields among all the five to 10 year maturities climbed steeply.
Despite that, buying in the afternoon ensured that the bond market lagged by a comfortable margin the decline in Germany's Bunds. -- Brussels Newsroom +32 2 287 6810, Fax +32 2 230 7710
